episodes.title: When Mindfulness Can Harm + Mindful Art Play | Mindfulness & Art Therapy Part 2
episodes.description:
This is Part Two of my mindfulness series. While mindfulness has many benefits, it’s not always safe—or helpful—in every context. In this video, I’ll explore the dangers of misused mindfulness, particularly how it can be weaponised in coercive groups, cults, or by controlling leaders.

Then, I’ll guide you through a gentle art therapy prompt to process your feelings and set healthy boundaries around your mindfulness practice.

✨ What you’ll learn in this video:
        •        How mindfulness can be misused as a control tactic
        •        Why it may not be safe for everyone in trauma recovery
        •        How to approach mindfulness with balance and boundaries
        •        A reflective art activity for self-protection and healing

🖌️ Art Prompt: Mindful Art Play.

If you’ve experienced coercive control, high-control groups, or trauma, this channel is here to support you with creative recovery tools.

episodes.title: How Cults Use Shame for Control | Healing with Art Therapy
episodes.description:
Cults thrive on shame — turning normal human struggles into “spiritual failures” and using guilt as a weapon of control. In this guided art therapy exercise, we’ll explore how shame shows up in cult contexts and how creativity can help you reclaim your voice, your self-worth, and your freedom.

✨ In this video:

- How cult leaders weaponize shame to keep people silent and obedient

- Why shame is so powerful in high-control groups

- A step-by-step art therapy prompt to work through shame: drawing circles for your good intentions and the “ickiness” of falling short

- How to build a bridge between the two — representing learning, self-forgiveness, and personal growth

Whether you’re recovering from a cult, spiritual abuse, or any high-control environment, this exercise will help you transform shame into strength through creative self-expression.

🎨 Try the activity with me and share your reflections in the comments. What did your bridge look like? What helped you connect your intentions with self-forgiveness?

episodes.title: Art Therapy for Recovery | Intro + Journal Cover Activity
episodes.description:
Welcome to Art Therapy for Recovery from Coercive Control! 🎨✨
I’m Renee, a community mental health practitioner and art therapist. This channel is a safe space for survivors of cults, coercive control, and other high-control relationships to heal and rebuild through creativity.

In this very first video, I’ll introduce the format of my channel, explain what art therapy is (and is not), and guide you through a simple, grounding art activity: designing your own journal cover and giving it a title.
This exercise helps you set an intention for your healing journey and create a space that’s truly your own.

💡 No art skills required! You only need basic materials — paper, pens, or whatever creative supplies you have on hand.

🌱 What you’ll find on this channel:
        •        Art therapy exercises for trauma recovery
        •        Healing tools for survivors of coercive control and cults
        •        Creative prompts to rebuild identity and self-trust
        •        Gentle psychology insights explained in everyday language
        •        A touch of metaphor and storytelling to make sense of recovery

🔔 Subscribe and join me each week as we explore new themes and creative practices to support your healing journey.

📕 Want to go deeper? Check out my counselling services at:
👉 https://www.recoverfromcoercivecontrol.com/

Let’s begin by making space for your healing story. 🖌️❤️

For more information about creative approaches to cults and information about high control groups in general: 
🌏 www.recoverfromcoercivecontrol.com
